  "description": "Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client is an African independent recording label and company established for the purpose of giving the world access to timeless music.

Due to expansion, they are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	We&rsquo;re looking for a culturally tuned-in Social Media Manager to lead the digital voice and presence of our artistes and label.
	This person will be responsible for shaping narratives, building community, and executing creative strategies across social platforms to grow engagement, reach, and fan loyalty.
	This role requires someone who lives and breathes music and understands how to turn moments into movements online.


Responsibilities


	Develop and manage content calendars for both the label and artiste accounts across Instagram, TikTok, X (Twitter), YouTube, Facebook, and Threads.
	Craft engaging captions, reels, tweets, and copy that align with each artiste&rsquo;s tone and current project cycle.
	Monitor online trends, viral moments, fan behavior, and digital conversations to insert the brand or artiste contextually.
	Lead community management: respond to fans, monitor sentiment, and build relationships across platforms.
	Collaborate with content teams to plan, produce, and post high-performing visuals (short-form clips, behind-the-scenes, lyric cards, trailers).
	Curate and edit short form clips short form clips for social/digital upload
	Track performance insights weekly, optimize strategies, and share reports with key stakeholders.
	Support influencer outreach and digital seeding plans around releases and key campaigns.
	Assist in planning digital rollouts for new music, videos, merch, and live events.
	Stay on top of platform changes (algorithms, tools, features) and recommend innovative strategies.


Requirements


	1&ndash;3 years of experience in social media management, preferably in the music/entertainment space.
	Strong copywriting skills with an ear for tone, nuance, and digital culture.
	Proven ability to grow engagement and followers across multiple platforms.
	Creative mindset with the ability to ideate and execute culturally relevant content.
	Basic design/video editing skills (e.g., Canva, CapCut, InShot) are a plus.
	Strong time management, organization, and communication skills.
	Passion for music, Afrobeats, and storytelling through digital platforms.
	Available to work in-person.


Method of Application

Social Media Manager Job at Fadac Resources and Services Limited




        
    

        
        Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client is an African independent recording label and company established for the purpose of giving the world access to timeless music.

Due to expansion, they are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We’re looking for a culturally tuned-in Social Media Manager to lead the digital voice and presence of our artistes and label.
	This person will be responsible for shaping narratives, building community, and executing creative strategies across social platforms to grow engagement, reach, and fan loyalty.
	This role requires someone who lives and breathes music and understands how to turn moments into movements online.


Responsibilities


	Develop and manage content calendars for both the label and artiste accounts across Instagram, TikTok, X (Twitter), YouTube, Facebook, and Threads.
	Craft engaging captions, reels, tweets, and copy that align with each artiste’s tone and current project cycle.
	Monitor online trends, viral moments, fan behavior, and digital conversations to insert the brand or artiste contextually.
	Lead community management: respond to fans, monitor sentiment, and build relationships across platforms.
	Collaborate with content teams to plan, produce, and post high-performing visuals (short-form clips, behind-the-scenes, lyric cards, trailers).
	Curate and edit short form clips short form clips for social/digital upload
	Track performance insights weekly, optimize strategies, and share reports with key stakeholders.
	Support influencer outreach and digital seeding plans around releases and key campaigns.
	Assist in planning digital rollouts for new music, videos, merch, and live events.
	Stay on top of platform changes (algorithms, tools, features) and recommend innovative strategies.


Requirements


	1–3 years of experience in social media management, preferably in the music/entertainment space.
	Strong copywriting skills with an ear for tone, nuance, and digital culture.
	Proven ability to grow engagement and followers across multiple platforms.
	Creative mindset with the ability to ideate and execute culturally relevant content.
	Basic design/video editing skills (e.g., Canva, CapCut, InShot) are a plus.
	Strong time management, organization, and communication skills.
	Passion for music, Afrobeats, and storytelling through digital platforms.
	Available to work in-person.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment1@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Recruitment Expert Job at Deloitte Human Capital Consulting
content:
Deloitte Human Capital Consulting is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Recruitment Expert

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in sourcing, assessing, and selecting top talent in diverse functional areas (e.g.,Admin & Finance, Health, ICT, Energy), and will play a key role in driving recruitment best practices. 
	This role requires exceptional communication skills, a results-driven mindset, and the ability to operate in a fast-paced, multicultural environment.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, including job briefing, sourcing, screening, interviewing, selection, and offer management for a variety of roles across departments
	Partner with hiring managers to understand workforce needs, define job requirements, and tailor recruitment strategies accordingly
	Develop and execute effective sourcing strategies using multiple channels (LinkedIn, job boards, referrals, recruitment agencies, etc.)
	Conduct interviews in both English and French, assessing candidates for technical, functional, and cultural fit.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records on the applicant tracking system (ATS) and ensure compliance with internal policies and external legal requirements.


Qualifications
Education & Experience Requirement:


	Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of recruitment experience, preferably within a fast-paced, multi-role hiring environment.
	Proven track record in successfully recruiting across different functions (e.g., Admin & Finance, Health, ICT, Energy etc).
	Experience recruiting in Francophone regions 
	Experience managing multiple open positions simultaneously.


Key Competencies:


	Fluent in French and English (Spoken and Written) - Mandatory
	Proficiency with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and HRIS platforms
	Strong command of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint).
	Familiarity with Boolean search techniques and digital sourcing tools
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet tight deadlines.
	High attention to detail and commitment to confidentiality.
	Proactive, resourceful, and resilient under pressure.

  "title": "Inventory and Store Officer",
  "description": "Logisoft Solutions is a Remote HR Management Service dedicated to building inclusive and engaging work cultures. We believe that great teams are built on collaboration, respect, and empowerment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory and Store Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Inventory and Store Officer is responsible for managing the store&rsquo;s inventory, ensuring products are properly stored, organized, and accurately tracked.
	This role involves overseeing stock levels, receiving deliveries, conducting stock audits, and ensuring that there are no shortages or wastage of bakery products and supplies.
	The officer will also ensure that inventory systems are kept up to date and that all stock movements are accurately recorded.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Management:


	Oversee daily inventory operations, including receiving and storing goods, organizing stock, and managing stock rotation.
	Ensure that all products, including bakery supplies and packaging materials, are properly stored to maintain quality and freshness.
	Regularly check stock levels to identify when products need to be restocked or reordered.
	Maintain accurate inventory records, ensuring that stock counts match the system records and identifying discrepancies when they arise.
	Monitor product expiry dates and rotate stock accordingly to minimize wastage.


Stock Monitoring &amp; Replenishment:


	Coordinate with the procurement or purchasing team to place orders for supplies, ensuring stock levels remain adequate without overstocking.
	Track and manage stock deliveries, ensuring all items are received as per the order specifications.
	Update inventory systems with new stock arrivals, product movements, and stock adjustments.
	Forecast inventory needs based on sales trends, promotions, and seasonal demand.


Stock Audits &amp; Reporting:


	Conduct regular inventory audits to reconcile physical stock with inventory system data.
	Report discrepancies or concerns to the store manager and take appropriate corrective actions.
	Provide daily, weekly, and monthly reports on stock levels, discrepancies, and stock turnover to management.


Organization &amp; Maintenance:


	Ensure that all inventory is organized and stored according to company standards and health and safety regulations.
	Keep storage areas clean and organized to ensure easy access to products and compliance with safety standards.
	Work closely with the team to ensure that the back-of-house area is managed efficiently, with minimal clutter.


Stock Movement &amp; Distribution:


	Oversee the movement of products from the storage area to the shop floor, ensuring that items are appropriately labeled and ready for use.
	Ensure that stock is distributed to the right sections of the store in an orderly and timely manner.
	Manage returns, damaged stock, and expired products by implementing proper disposal or return procedures.


Customer Service Support:


	Work closely with the floor supervisor and team to ensure that products are available on time and there are no stock shortages during peak hours.
	Assist in locating out-of-stock or hard-to-find items for customers.


Qualifications
Education:


	High School Diploma or equivalent required; a degree or certification in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or Business Administration is an advantage.


Experience:


	At least 1-2 years of experience in inventory management, stock control, or related fields, preferably in a retail or food service environment.
	Experience with inventory management systems or software is a plus.


Skills &amp; Abilities:


	Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
	Good numerical and analytical abilities.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proficiency in using inventory management software.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Basic knowledge of food safety standards and storage practices.


Physical Requirements:


	Ability to lift and carry items up to 25-30 lbs.
	Ability to stand, bend, and move for extended periods.


Benefits


	Salary: N100,000 - N200,000 monthly.
	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunities for career growth and training.
	Employee discounts on products.
	Positive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates shouldsend their CVs and/or Cover letter to:&nbsp;logisoftsolutions.ng@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Ensure you live around Admiralty Road, Lekki Phase 1 or&nbsp;Macpherson, Ikoyi.
	Must be available to work on weekends.
